alert.note: Alert for Delta; Gunnison (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 5:57PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Colorado, including the following counties, Delta and Gunnison. * WHEN...Until 715 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 557 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hoodoo Creek, Minnesota Creek, Gunnison River, McDonald Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Jay Creek and Smith Fork. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paonia and Hotchkiss. This also includes Highway 133 from mile marker 1 to 9, including the intersection of Highway 92 near Hotchkiss.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
